body: @michaelschiff yes the carbon server will do the aggregation  then you can still do more aggregation vi the graphite UI

The integration test modification is done with https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2470.
Perhaps the other part could be handled by adding a comment to the deprecated function saying that only part of it is actually deprecated, and that the function should not be removed, only have the part of it that handles kill=true removed.

@fjy We have a plan to use this but currently it's not yet applied. So no need to rush to include this in near release versions.
@cheddar It's an internal interface only used internally. We can do anything with that.

The endpoint `/druid/coordinator/v1/datasources/{dataSourceName}?kill={value}&interval={myISO8601Interval}` still exits (but is deprecated) and should not throw exception with `kill=false`. The tests are failing because #2276 also changed the integration test code [here](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2276/files#diff-6915392a73fa8bd21a09ceb9180107daL139) to use new endpoint which will throw exception with `kill=false`, so if that change is reverted everything should work but I think we can use the change you did in this PR as that endpoint is [deprecated](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2276/files#diff-9ad19c35d703fbc035ab9725dcbb9fafR171) now.

Also I think we do not need `kill` parameter at all for the new [endpoint](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/server/src/main/java/io/druid/server/http/DatasourcesResource.java#L208) introduced in #2276
@andresgomezfrr hoe does sorting by ip will fix the issue ?

thought that [this code](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/62ba9ade37f2ab96d3894a0eb622ed5e4f290a03/indexing-service/src/main/java/io/druid/indexing/overlord/setup/EqualDistributionWorkerSelectStrategy.java#L58-L58) will filter out the disable host since it is less than the `minWorkerVer`

Let me try to explain it!

Is true that  [this code](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/62ba9ade37f2ab96d3894a0eb622ed5e4f290a03/indexing-service/src/main/java/io/druid/indexing/overlord/setup/EqualDistributionWorkerSelectStrategy.java#L58-L58) will filter out the disable host using the minWorkerVer. The problem is that when sortedWorkers are sorted using the method compare if two or more worker have the same getCurrCapacityUsed(), the Comparator only return one of them. So on the scenario that I explained sometimes the only worker that the Comparator return is the AAA and it is disabled. 

On my pull request, if two middleManager have the same getCurrCapacityUsed, I will sort them using the IP address (I use the middleManager IP address because I suppose that it is unique inside druid cluster), doing that all the workers are returned on sortedWorkers and later, them will filter out using the minWorkerVer.
this is failing UT
I have done the fixes and including a bug. New request will be submit soon after conflict check. Sorry for the delay of 10 days long holiday.
#2393 didn't merged changes from #2291 correctly. Totally my bad. @CHOIJAEHONG1 Could you add false for map lookup in `GroupByQueryRunnerTest`?
@navis No problem. I will add it.
test cannot pass on master. Module `druid-processing`  failed.
@himanshug LGTM. We use similiar method to this internally but more ugly implemented and have no time to clear the code...
@xvrl @drcrallen: handled the review comments, please have a look again.

@b-slim this makes a lot more sense now.  Can you clarify how this is handled for a metric like `segment/count`?  In the Coordinator this metric has dimension `datasource` which is left off by default in the Graphite Emitter.   Assuming this metric displays instantaneous values, rather than deltas (i.e. ds1 has 10 segments, not ds1 += 10 segments), how are these aggregated at Graphite's end?  Druid would be emitting 2 different metrics `segment/count.ds1 = 10` & `segment/count.ds2=50` but we would only send `segment/count = 10` & `segment/count = 50`. Are these intended to be averaged by Ganglia? I would have assumed you care about the sum, but I don't see how it can do this without storing the component sums in full granularity.
I updated my branch to the current druid master branch.
:+1: , nice catch
@gianm  / @himanshug rebased.

Yeah, you are right @drcrallen, the "correct" assumption is host/port combination. I can see that 
`zkWorker.getWorker().getHost()`
is made using host and port ([worker creation](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/services/src/main/java/io/druid/cli/CliMiddleManager.java#L106)), so I suppose that this is fine. 

I added some comments explaining the reason because is needed the host sorting. What do you think about them?

The intent of the versions of the segment binary formats is to allow us to make changes and add new functionality going forward.  The current code doesn't actually allow for producing v8 segments without doing a bunch of extra work (as you said, you had to manually create the segments).  That's by design, the v9 segment is the one that is currently supported and intended to be created.

There is an unfortunate historical artifact in the creation of the v9 segments in that they first persist v8 and then convert to v9.  There was a PR somewhere to build v9 directly, in which case the v8-related code will only be used in the read path and we don't expect any legacy v8 segment to have LONG metric columns. 

So, while I appreciate the fix, I don't think this code is necessary at this point.  :-1: 

If there is a specific use case or this is causing a bug in your deployment, please let us know.
Discussed in dev sync that this should probably go in a 0.9.0 and since it is incompatible it was an oversight for the 0.9.0 release.
@b-slim can you rebase this one to clean up stuff?
@b-slim also if this is ready for final code review please remove discuss

@drcrallen told that `the "correct" assumption at the moment is that a middle manager is unique in its host/port combination.` and the problem is that the version can be the same across all middle managers, isn't?
@andresgomezfrr  if one of the woker is disable the version is empty string so by construction it will be different from other worker unless both are disable.

ohh, it's true @b-slim ! so I think that this is other possible :+1: so .. I suppose that we can change [FillCapacityWorkerSelectStrategy](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/indexing-service/src/main/java/io/druid/indexing/overlord/setup/FillCapacityWorkerSelectStrategy.java#L54) too What do you think @drcrallen ?

yes

@rasahner can you please file an issue against 0.9.0 and include the following:

The system classpath jars, the layout of extension directories and what files are in them, which extensions are in the list to be included, and the layout of the hadoop directory?

For some reason the jar which contains the druid-api classes is being injected in a weird place.

This worked for @gianm on EMR, so I'm guessing it is related to how the jars are packaged in the test deployment. Any help you can give in debugging would be appreciated.

@andresgomezfrr sure you can use it in both cases !
@andresgomezfrr thanks for the contrib :+1:
you're welcome! :smile:
I don't have any explicit cases where this causes a problem yet, so I'm not labeling it as anything in particular.
@andresgomezfrr i am not sure if you have filled the [CLA](http://druid.io/community/cla.html), general question to @fjy where we can check who is on the list of CLA ?

@b-slim I think only PMC has access to that list right now. For privacy reasons it might stay that way for right now. I'd like to get some sort of github hook in so manual checking isn't needed. But for now bugging one of the PMC members is the best we have.  @andresgomezfrr is not on the list so please do fill out the CLA at the link provided.

@b-slim A potential use case for static configs is pre-propagating login information for jdbc based lookups (user/pass) which you don't want stored in an easily fetchable location

Added configurable dimension filtering per @b-slim's suggestion.  This allows the StatsD server to properly bucket `count` and `timer` type metrics by the prefix of dimensions you configured to keep. `gauge` type metrics are by default configured to emit at full granularity, as StatsD does not currently support aggregations across gauges so emitting them with some dimensions dropped would just act as conflicting values.

not merging yet because I think we should talk about a more reasonable default value for maxRowsinMemory

There is also a third default value, which is Tranquility's value of 75000. That takes precedence over the 500000 in RealtimeTuningConfig. It's lower on the grounds that it's better for a default to be somewhat less efficient, and work, than to reach for the stars and possibly OOM.
